properties.areaDesc: Reno Beach to The Islands OH beyond 5NM off shoreline to US-Canadian border; Detroit River Lt. to Maumee Bay OH to Reno Beach OH beyond 5NM offshoreline to US-Canadian border
properties.headline: Low Water Advisory issued January 18 at 9:57AM EST until January 19 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland OH
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Gale Warning, west winds 30 to 40 knots, with
gusts up to 50 knots, and waves 4 to 7 feet expected. For the
Low Water Advisory, abnormally low water levels expected.

* WHERE...Lake Erie open waters from Maumee Bay to Reno Beach OH
and Lake Erie open waters from Reno Beach to The Islands OH.

* WHEN...For the Gale Warning, from 3 PM this afternoon to 7 AM
EST Sunday. For the Low Water Advisory, from 3 PM this
afternoon to 11 AM EST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Strong winds will cause hazardous waves which could
capsize or damage vessels and reduce visibility. Below normal
water levels will result in hazardous navigating conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...As of 9:50 AM EST Saturday, the water level
at Toledo was 63 inches above low water datum, or 39 inches
above the critical mark for safe navigation. Strong west winds
over the western basin of Lake Erie are expected to cause water
levels to drop below the critical mark late this afternoon
through late Sunday morning.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should alter plans to avoid these hazardous conditions.
Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or secure the
vessel for severe conditions.

Mariners should navigate shallow waters with extreme caution due
to below normal water levels.

NWSheadline: LOW WATER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM EST SUNDAY... ...GALE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 AM EST SUNDAY
